freenet.client.async
Class ClientContext

java.lang.Object
  freenet.client.async.ClientContext

public class ClientContext
extends Object

Object passed in to client-layer operations, containing references to essential but mostly transient objects such as the schedulers and the FEC queue.

Author:
toad

start

public void start(ClientPutter inserter,
                  boolean earlyEncode)
           throws InsertException,
                  DatabaseDisabledException
Start an insert. Queue a database job if it is a persistent insert, otherwise start it right now.

Parameters:
inserter - The insert to start.
earlyEncode - Whether to try to encode the data and insert the upper layers as soon as possible. Normally we wait for each layer to complete before inserting the next one because an attacker may be able to identify lower blocks once the top block has been inserted (e.g. if it's a known SSK).
Throws:
InsertException - If the insert is transient and it fails to start.
DatabaseDisabledException - If the insert is persistent and the database is disabled (e.g. because it is encrypted and the user hasn't entered the password yet).

start

public void start(ClientGetter getter)
           throws FetchException,
                  DatabaseDisabledException
Start a request. Schedule a job on the database thread if it is persistent, otherwise start it immediately.

Parameters:
getter - The request to start.
Throws:
FetchException - If the request is transient and failed to start.
DatabaseDisabledException - If the request is persistent and the database is disabled.

start

public void start(SimpleManifestPutter inserter)
           throws InsertException,
                  DatabaseDisabledException
Start a site insert. Schedule a job on the database thread if it is persistent, otherwise start it immediately.

Parameters:
inserter - The request to start.
Throws:
InsertException - If the insert is transient and failed to start.
DatabaseDisabledException - If the insert is persistent and the database is disabled.

start

public void start(BaseManifestPutter inserter)
           throws InsertException,
                  DatabaseDisabledException
Start a new-style site insert. Schedule a job on the database thread if it is persistent, otherwise start it immediately.

Parameters:
inserter - The request to start.
Throws:
InsertException - If the insert is transient and failed to start.
DatabaseDisabledException - If the insert is persistent and the database is disabled.

getBucketFactory

public BucketFactory getBucketFactory(boolean persistent)
Get the temporary bucket factory appropriate for a request.

Parameters:
persistent - If true, get the persistent temporary bucket factory. This creates buckets which persist across restarts of the node. If false, get the temporary bucket factory, which creates buckets which will be deleted once the node is restarted.

getFetchScheduler

public RequestScheduler getFetchScheduler(boolean ssk)
Get the RequestScheduler responsible for the given key type. This is used to queue low level requests.

Parameters:
ssk - If true, get the SSK request scheduler. If false, get the CHK request scheduler.

objectCanNew

public boolean objectCanNew(com.db4o.ObjectContainer container)
Tell db4o never to store the ClientContext in the database. If it did it would pull in all sorts of stuff and we end up persisting the entire node, which is both dangerous and expensive.

setFECQueue

public void setFECQueue(FECQueue fecQueue2)
Set the FEC queue after startup e.g. late startup when the database is encrypted.

setPersistentBucketFactory

public void setPersistentBucketFactory(PersistentTempBucketFactory persistentTempBucketFactory,
                                       FilenameGenerator persistentFilenameGenerator)
Set the persistent bucket factories after pulling them from the database. Normally called after a late database startup e.g. when the database is encrypted.

Parameters:
persistentTempBucketFactory - The persistent temporary bucket factory.
persistentFilenameGenerator - The filename generator underlying the persistent temporary bucket factory. This generates filenames, remembers the directory where the files are, etc.
